result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid. 
*Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision in case numbers 2015CF4212 and 2017CF1648. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: With case number 2015CM2992, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with credit for 48 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. (to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison)

records.addlTxt: Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Tony D Smith not in court, in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case remains calendared in Br. 24 for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Tony D Smith in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Tony D Smith in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on warrant scheduled for April 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tony D Smith in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to Count 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tony D Smith in court with attorney  Ann Heaps for  Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 22. Court ordered case transferred to branch 22 for global resolution if accepted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tony D Smith in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed. Judge wants case to remain in branch 47 for plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Branch 22 accepts this case for global resolution with case# 15CF4212.

Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tony D Smith in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
